eu.play_project.play_eventadapter

Class AbstractReceiverRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.play_project.play_eventadapter.AbstractReceiverRest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RdfReceiver

    public abstract class AbstractReceiverRest
extends Object
implements RdfReceiver
    A consumer of PLAY events. It can subscribe to PLAY RDF events and deal with the necessary un-marshalling and parsing. The REST endpoint is fixed because subscriptions (and later unsubscriptions) are stateful. Subscriptions require a local HTTP endpoint to receieve callbacks. Examples of deploying such an endpoint can be found in Unit Tests eu.play_project.play_eventadapter.tests.SendAndReceiveSoapTest.
    Author:
    Roland St√ºhmer

      AbstractReceiverRest()

      Create a receiever using the specified PLAY platform endpoint.
      AbstractReceiverRest(String subscribeEndpoint, String topicsEndpoint)
      Create a receiever using the specified PLAY endpoints to make subscriptions and get topics.

        public String subscribe(String topic,
               String notificationsEndPoint)
        Description copied from interface: RdfReceiver
        Subscribe to a topic at the endpoint in AbstractReceiverRest(String). The callback will be used by the DSB to send the subscriptions. It is your responsibility to prevent/avoid duplicate subscriptions if needed.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface RdfReceiver
        notificationsEndPoint - callback SOAP URI to receive notifications
        Returns:
        subscription ID as URI resource
